programmes.show_description: Workers Unite: Terry is none too happy when June takes a temporary job (shocking in the early eighties!) - and life soon becomes very complicated. More British sitcom gold.
Only Two Can Play: June tries to learn to play the cello. How's Terry going to cope with all the practice? Ear-muffs, maybe? More classic sitcom fun with 'Carry On' star Terry Scott.
The Lawnmower: Terry and June get off to a bad start with their new neighbours in a dispute over a lawnmower. Soon things escalate when Terry gets a bee in his bonnet. Sitcom gold!
Stars on Sunday: Classic comedy from the TV husband and wife who were so convincing many people thought they were married in real life. The couple visit Terry's boss in hospital.
Disco Fever: The couple take up dancing lessons in readiness for Terry's office party.
Workers Unite: Terry is none too happy when June takes a temporary job (shocking in the early eighties!) - and life soon becomes very complicated. More British sitcom gold.
Only Two Can Play: June tries to learn to play the cello. How's Terry going to cope with all the practice? Ear-muffs, maybe? More classic sitcom fun with 'Carry On' star Terry Scott.

Life on the North Yorkshire Moors Railway, following an eventful week during which plans are made to welcome star steam engine Royal Scot to the heritage railway.
Shopping from Home.
Death Behind Bars: An American prison for the violent and deranged with links to an infamous cult leader, and a cavernous tunnel network in France offering shelter from unrelenting bombardment.
Ghosts of the Swamp: Forgotten relics from the defence of America's homeland, concealed by the banks of the Mississippi, and a concrete behemoth on the French coast that proved invulnerable.
A Nation Torn Apart: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in America that helped tear apart a nation.

Mothers and Brothers: More troubles for Ronnie Corbett in the long-running sitcom. Tim's sister persuades him that the only way to escape Mother's clutches is to buy his own home.
Every Day in Every Way: Classic laughs with Ronnie Corbett as the chap striving to forge his own path in life, away from his domineering mother. Timothy is given a lucky charm.
A Fool and His Money: Everyone's favourite cuddly comedian, the smaller of the Two Ronnies, stars in the classic sitcom. Timothy is in danger of being tricked by an old friend.
Flying Lessons: Classic comedy with one half of timeless duo the Two Ronnies. Timothy gets as far as making a date with his dream girl, but Mother does her best to ruin things.
Winter's Tales: The vintage sitcom with Ronnie Corbett as the middle-aged man trying to escape his mother's influence. Timothy makes the mistake of showing Mother around his new home.

Expandable Bodies: David Attenborough examines creatures that have fascinated us for centuries. This episode looks at the expandable bodies of anacondas and camels.
Shopping from Home.
Heroes of comedy Ronnie Barker and Ronnie Corbett with sketches including Send in the Clones and The Admirable Brighton.
The late, great Ronnies - Messrs Barker and Corbett - offer up more timeless comedy magic. The classic sketches include Village of the Smiths and Born to be Wild.
Laughter and levity with Barker and Corbett. Sketches include Office Party, Indian Cookery, Barn Dance, Water and Secret of the Sorcerer's Tomb.

The Doctor's first adventure in a new form begins as a top-secret scientific project attracts dangerous attention.
As tensions rise around the experiment, the Doctor uncovers plans that could put the entire world at risk.
With control slipping away, the threat grows larger and harder to stop.
The Doctor confronts the full danger in a high-stakes effort to prevent global catastrophe.
The Doctor arrives in a quiet village where familiar faces and strange behaviour hint that something is very wrong.
